primary_trope.name: hidden_gem
primary_trope.hook_text: The best race you've never heard of.
primary_trope.mechanism: FOMO / loss aversion — the viewer is MISSING something. Losses feel 2.5x stronger than equivalent gains.

beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: We gave Lost River Classic the verdict: Honest Appalachian Grinder. Elite tier. 66 out of 100. Let me tell you what that really means.
beats.text_on_screen: Lost River Classic: Honest Appalachian Grinder
beats.visual: Verdict badge slam + tier badge + avatar
beats.editing_note: Open with verdict like a boxing title card. Avatar with villain energy. Music: ominous build. PROMISE the viewer they'll learn the real story.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap + cognitive dissonance (verdict vs expectation).

beats.label: WHAT THEY TELL YOU
beats.narration: Every race has a highlight reel. Here's theirs.
beats.visual: Marketing highlights overlay — strengths as bullet points
beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: Legitimate elevation challenge (8,500 ft over 85 mi) tests climbing endurance
Technical terrain demands strong bike handling and rewards skill development
Benefits Lost River Trails Coalition—racing with purpose beyond personal glory
Grassroots community vibe with genuine local support and WV Gravel Series camaraderie
Excellent value: $65-85 for challenging course and trail advocacy contribution

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.visual: Red flag overlay — weaknesses with warning icons

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Technical Appalachian gravel with constant elevation change

beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: August heat + humidity creates serious heat management challenge; not beginner-friendly climate
30-mile aid station gaps require genuine self-sufficiency; no hand-holding
Rural location (2 hrs from Dulles) with limited lodging requires advance planning
Limited national recognition means small field and minimal competitive depth
Spotty cell service and remote sections—if you need constant safety net, skip it

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. No opinions. Just scores. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Hardy County, West Virginia sits at standard East Coast elevations where oxygen isn't a factor. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Hardy County native Austin Williams returned from Texas for this race, illustrating how far riders travel to reach Mathias, West Virginia. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. This West Virginia Gravel Series event drew 200 riders in 2025, with prize purses reaching $1000 for winners.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: The Lost River Classic rewards self-sufficient riders who value authentic challenge over curated experience. If you need perfectly spaced aid, luxury lodging, and Instagram-worthy branding, this isn't your race. If you want to test yourself against honest Appalachian terrain while supporting trail advocacy. And you're willing to manage heat stress and technical descents without constant support, you'll leave satisfied. The suffering is real, but it's the good kind.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.

beats.narration: Full breakdown. All 14 dimensions. Free prep kit. Link in bio.
beats.editing_note: Keep energy up. Don't wind down.
